The Act is titled the "Griffith Project Prepayment and Conveyance Act" and includes definitions for various terms used within the Act. The Act, titled the "Griffith Project Prepayment and Conveyance Act," defines key terms such as "Authority" as the Southern Nevada Water Authority, "Griffith Project" as the Robert B. Griffith Water Project, "Secretary" as the Secretary of the Interior, and "Acquired Land(s)" as interests in land acquired by the United States. The term "Public Land" refers to lands under Federal ownership managed by the Bureau of Land Management. "Withdrawn Land" refers to Federal lands reserved for specific public purposes under certain laws and managed by the Bureau of Reclamation or the National Park Service. SEC. 3. CONVEYANCE OF GRIFFITH PROJECT. The Authority will assume liability for the Griffith Project from the United States upon prepayment of $121,204,348. The Secretary will convey all rights, interests, and facilities of the project to the Authority, including improvements, acquired lands, and reserved interests in patented lands. The Authority will have a right-of-way across Public and Withdrawn Land for the Griffith Project without cost, valid for municipal water supply purposes. Within twelve months, the Secretary and the Authority will agree on the land description and document the rights-of-way. If the conveyance does not occur within twelve months, a report will be submitted to Congress. The Secretary and the Authority may modify existing contracts and permits to comply with this Act. This Act also relates to other laws and future benefits. Upon conveyance of the Griffith Project, it shall no longer receive Reclamation benefits and will no longer be considered a Federal Reclamation Project. Federal ownership and rights in Lake Mead National Recreation Area associated lands will not be affected. Upon conveyance of the Griffith Project under applicable legislation, the United States shall not be liable for damages based on prior ownership.
